text:
He crept down the stairs like a cat. 

Avoiding her gossip and demands, he slipped outside. 

The street heat was unbearable. 

He felt fear tighten around him. 

“I want to attempt a thing like that,” he thought, smiling oddly. 

“Cowardice makes men let opportunities slip away.” 

He pondered what men truly feared. 

“New steps, new words,” he muttered. 

“Why am I going there now?” 

“Am I capable of that?” 

“It’s just a fantasy,” he decided. 

The stench of the city choked him. 

Drunken men stumbled past, adding to his misery. 

He clenched his fists, nerves frayed.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man grapples with his fears and insecurities while navigating a suffocating and unpleasant environment.
